p.s: After summarising the extract it is important to have a look on how Lady Macbeth tries to convince Macbeth to get a murder.
Lady Macbeth starts to convince him with making him unconfident with his opinion.
Was the hope drunk wherein you dressed yourself?(l. 8-9).
It is a rhetorical question which has the intention to make Macbeth insecure.
After that she wants to show that his minds are not clear in the moment And wakes it now to look so green and pale (l. 10).
Lady Macbeth says that he looks hung over.
She wants to say that he does not look good at the moment and he does not think like when he is good.
Macbeth's wife says she values his love Such I account thy love (l. 12).
She means the love he has because of which he does not want to kill Duncan but she lies.
Lady Macbeth does not value his love if she would value it, she would not want him to be a murdermurderer.
After that she tries with a rhetorical question to asksask about his behaviour as a menman.
Are thou afeard to be the same in thine own act and valour as thou art in desire?(l. 12ff.).
A menman is not afraid to be brave but she wants to make him think about if he is a real menman when he is afraid.
She continues with a strong word coward (l. 16).
It is clear no one wantwants to be a coward but she wants him to think that he would be a coward the whole life if he does not kill Duncan.
Further Macbeth's wife uses a comparison Like the poor cat i'th'adage? (l. 18).
She compares him with a cat that wants the fish but would not even have the fish's wet paw.
The fish is the title for a king in the comparison.
The wet paw could be compared to the sharp point of a crown.
In line 26 When you durst do it, then you were a menman tries Lady Macbeth another time to persuade her husband with explaining him to be a menman.
So he gets insecure if he is a real menman and does what she wants to be a real menman for her eyes.
Further Lady Macbeth says that the right time is now They have made themselves and their fitness now does unmake you (l. 30-31).
She wants to convince him that it is the right moment to do it.
After that she uses a metaphor which she compares with his situation.
I would, while it was smiling in my face, have plucked my nipple from his boneless gums(l. 33f.).
So she wants to say while the baby is sweet to her she would be rude to the baby.
The same way Macbeth should act.
Both of them had sworn to act like this.
And dashed the brains our, had I sworn as you have done to this(l. 35f.).
Lady Macbeth is clever she uses Macbeth's promises to get what she wants.
After a question from Macbeth, Lady Macbeth says to him that they would fail We fail (l. 39).
She wants him to encourage with this.
She wants to show no matter what happens they should kill kingKing Duncan.
She continues with encouraging him But screw your courage to the sticking place, and we'll not fail (l. 40f.).
She says it he is brave they would not fail.
His wife wants to make Macbeth confident in her minds and she wants to be her mind his minds.
Lady Macbeth continues with telling her plan.
She shows that she knows Duncan so she is not insecure in her plan.
Whereto the rather shall his day's hard journey(l. 42).
Further she uses a metaphor the receipt of reason a limbeck only (l. 47f.).
She shows with the metaphor that the servants will be so drunk that they will nothing know.
With a rhetorical question she ends Who shall bear the guilt of our quell? (l. 52f.).
She wants to show that no one can get the chance to see what will happen and she calls Macbeth a a great quell.
She behaves like Macbeth had said that he wants to do it.
Further she gives him a compliment.
All in all Lady Macbeth persuades Macbeth to be a murdermurderer with a lot of speaking and not allowing him to have his own thoughts.
She uses stylistic devices like metaphors to show him that he should be a brave menman and not a coward.
She is very ambitious for power as you can see in this extract.
